column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=Curry Powder is ordinarily a mixture of turmeric, black
#Text=pepper, coriander seeds, cayenne, cardamoms, cumin, fenugreek, ginger, allspice, and cloves.
#Text=Turmeric, the ingredient
#Text=furnishing the colouring matter, forms the largest proportion.
#Text=There is only a small quantity of cayenne, cardamoms,
#Text=cumin, and fenugreek.
#Text=Ginger, allspice, and cloves are often
#Text=omitted.
#Text=Turmeric powder is obtained from the Curucma
#Text=longa.
#Text=The ground turners of the plant are dried and
#Text=ground to flour.
#Text=It is said to be adulterated with alkali to
#Text=heighten the colour, and with yellow ochre.
#Text=The fruit of the coriander is round, and nearly as large as white pepper.
#Text=It contains two brown-coloured hemispherical seeds, having
#Text=an aromatic taste and odour.
#Text=The seed-vessels, or pods, of
#Text=cardamom are of triangular form, each containing several
#Text=hard, reddish-brown seeds, having a pungent taste, and
#Text=popularly known as "grains of paradise."
#Text=Cumin and fenugreek seeds are aromatic seeds having a peculiar medicinal
#Text=taste and odour.
#Text=The characteristic flavour of curry is due
#Text=largely to the cumin it contains.
#Text=Curry has been found to
#Text=be adulterated with ground rice, potato starch, common salt,
#Text=red lead, and ferruginous earths.
#Text=Olive Oil is expressed from olives, the fruit of a well-known
#Text=tree cultivated in many European countries.
#Text=Olives should
#Text=furnish from 20 to 25 per cent, of their weight of oil, but
#Text=the whole yield is not usually of the same quality.
#Text=The
#Text=pure oil is pale yellow, transparent, of agreeable odour and
#Text=bland taste.
#Text=It keeps well, being little liable to become
#Text=rancid.
#Text=Olive oil is not infrequently adulterated with cotton-seed
#Text=oil, rape oil, and other cheap vegetable oils.
#Text=Taking the
#Text=specific gravity is often sufficient to show there is an adulterant present, and to warrant the food inspector in sending
#Text=a sample to an expert.
#Text=The specific gravity of olive oil is
#Text=917-6 at 59 deg.
#Text=Fah.
#Text=Vinegar. — Commercial vinegar is a more or less impure
#Text=acetic acid.
#Text=Besides acetic acid it usually contains some
#Text=alcohol, acetic ether, sugar, gum, various salts, &c, its composition depending to some extent on the substances from
#Text=which it has been produced.
#Text=The different varieties of vinegar, according to their
#Text=source, are malt, wine, cider, beet, sugar, and wood vinegars.
#Text=Acetic acid is the volatile principle in all, to the presence of
#Text=which vinegar mainly owes its aroma and pungency.
#Text=It
#Text=may be generated by the fermentation  of many vegetable
#Text=and some animal substances.
#Text=Any vegetable infusion
#Text=capable of yielding alcohol will furnish vinegar.
